answerText: David Herbert Lawrence[10] His Travels Through France and Italy is much less well known than his picaresque novel about an adventurer who marries the beautiful Narcissa in Roderick Random.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 6 | 2 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Name these authors of travel narratives, for 10 points each: [10]  He wrote about his travels in Sketches of Etruscan Places and Mornings in Mexico, but he's more famous for writing about a sexually frustrated woman having an affair with Oliver Mellors in Lady Chatterly's Lover.
